[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Threshold Racing] Can an attacker monitor diff_threshold2_timer and call update_single_price repeatedly just before max_duration_within_thresholds expires, preventing level_major alerts from triggering? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Historical Price Poisoning] If an attacker can inject a manipulated price that passes all validations once, can this poisoned historical_price then be used to validate future extreme prices through span validation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Multi-Feed Attack] Can an attacker coordinate price manipulations across multiple feeds to create correlated failures that bypass individual feed validations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Max Timestamp Diff DoS] If max_timestamp_diff is set to 0, no prices can be fresh (current_timestamp - oracle_timestamp < 0 is impossible) - can admin error or malicious config cause permanent DoS? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Threshold Inversion] If price_diff_threshold1 > price_diff_threshold2 due to config error, can validate_price_difference produce inverted severity levels, misclassifying critical deviations as normal? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Effective Price Bounds Invalid] If maximum_effective_price < minimum_effective_price, all prices fail validation - can this config error cause permanent feed unavailability? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Oracle ID Collision] If multiple feeds share the same oracle_id due to config error, can updates to one feed corrupt another feed's state in the PriceOracle? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: get_price_from_adaptor()] [Pair ID Substitution] If pair_id is changed after oracle_provider_config is set, can the assertion at line 177 be bypassed by updating both values simultaneously, allowing wrong price feeds? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [History vs Oracle Price Skew] Lines 162 and 164 update history and oracle price separately - if a transaction reads between these updates, can it observe inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Timer State Corruption] If start_or_continue_diff_threshold2_timer at line 157 fails but doesn't revert, can the timer state become corrupted, causing incorrect severity calculations in future updates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Event Emission Ordering] Events are emitted at various return points - can event reordering or omission cause off-chain systems to have incorrect understanding of oracle state? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Partial Update Rollback] If oracle::update_price at line 164 fails, are the history update at line 162 and timer changes at lines 157/159 rolled back, or can partial state changes persist? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Cascading Returns] Multiple early returns (lines 61, 76, 81, 118, 130, 153) cause silent failures - can an attacker trigger these conditions systematically to prevent any price updates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Gas Cost Manipulation] If validate_price_difference or validate_price_range_and_history are computationally expensive, can an attacker configure thresholds to maximize gas cost, making price updates uneconomical? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: get_price_from_adaptor()] [Adaptor Call Failure] If Supra or Pyth adaptor calls fail without proper error handling, can this cause transaction reversion that prevents all oracle updates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Config Table Bloat] If price_feed or oracle_provider_configs tables grow unbounded, can this cause gas exhaustion in get_price_feed_mut at line 59? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Primary-Secondary Flip Attack] Can an attacker alternate between making primary and secondary stale to force continuous oracle source switching, creating price volatility? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Threshold Walking] Can an attacker keep primary-secondary price difference just below threshold2 continuously, accumulating small price deviations that bypass major/critical alerts but sum to large manipulation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Historical Span Gaming] If maximum_allowed_span_percentage is set high, can an attacker gradually ratchet prices up/down over multiple updates, each within span limits but achieving large total manipulation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Decimal Precision Exploitation] Can an attacker exploit rounding differences between high and low decimal target values to systematically bias prices in one direction? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: get_price_from_adaptor()] [Oracle Provider Compromise] If either Supra or Pyth provider is compromised and returns malicious prices, can these pass all validation checks if within configured bounds? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Stale Price Economic Impact] When function returns early without updating prices (lines 61, 76, 81, 130, 153), dependent protocols use stale prices - can this cause economic loss in lending/borrowing/trading protocols? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Price Lag Arbitrage] If max_timestamp_diff is large, prices can be up to that duration stale - can arbitrageurs exploit this lag to profit from price differences between oracle and market? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Threshold Level Impact] Different severity levels (normal/warning/major/critical) only emit events - but if no on-chain enforcement exists, can protocols continue operating unsafely during major/critical events? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle_pro.move] [Function: update_single_price()] [Circuit Breaker Absence] When validation fails or prices deviate critically, no circuit breaker halts dependent protocols - can this allow cascading failures during oracle disruptions? (Critical)
